title: Rust Deployment Philosophy - Pain Upfront, Ship Clean
summary: Rust's deployment model frontloads complexity at compile time, producing single binaries with zero runtime dependencies. Contrast with Python's easy-write-nightmare-deploy pattern.

patterns: pain at compile time not runtime

examples.python_deploy: create venv, activate, pip install, wrong version, try pip3, externally managed environment, give up

antipatterns: requiring rust toolchain for end users
wisdom: The best code is code users never have to think about
Double click, it works - that's the bar
Complexity belongs at compile time, not install time
Your nan should be able to run it

author: BMETALC
